state_analysis: The command to remove the initramfs directory has timed out again, which indicates that the QEMU session is still blocking further commands due to the kernel panic. The kernel is unable to mount the root filesystem as indicated by the repeated errors.
explanation: Given the persistent issues, I will forcefully terminate the QEMU session and recreate the initramfs with the necessary components. I will ensure to double-check the init script and recreate the initramfs before attempting to boot again.

commands.keystrokes:
echo -e '#!/bin/sh
mount -t proc /proc
mount -t sysfs /sys
exec /bin/sh' > /tmp/initramfs/init/init
